channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Father 'slits wife and teenage daughter's throats'
item.description: A father is thought to have 'slit his wife and his teenage daughter's throats' before neighbours tackled him to the ground as he tried to flee the scene in Salisbury.

item.title: Parisians flock for a drink at midnight as France reopens its beloved cafes and restaurants
item.description: Bars, restaurants and cafes threw open their doors across the country today, although in Paris - where the virus has been more prevalent - seating will only be permitted on outside terraces.

item.title: Emily Maitlis returns to BBC Newsnight screens with no mention of the Dominic Cummings monologue row
item.description: The presenter was found to have violated the BBC's impartiality guidelines following her monologue on Dominic Cummings last week that said he had 'broken the rules' and 'the country can see that'.

item.title: MPs turn on Jacob Rees-Mogg for forcing them to return to Commons
item.description: The Commons is returning from recess in uproar over moves to 'normalise' business despite the raging coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Keeping one metre apart slashes the risk of catching coronavirus by 80%
item.description: The new research, funded by the World Health Organisation (WHO), will add to the clamour for Britain's two-metre rule social distancing rule to be relaxed.

item.title: Deaths of people with learning disabilities DOUBLED during Covid-19 crisis
item.description: A report published today by the CQC showed that 386 people receiving social care for learning disabilities died between April 10 and May 15, up from 165 in the same period last year.

item.title: Easyjet says it will resume flights to almost three quarters of its network by August
item.description: The airline is also launching what it claims is its 'biggest ever summer sale' with over one million flights to holiday destinations across Europe on offer from £29.99.

item.title: Women are more likely than men to become binge drinkers because of hormones
item.description: Female mice found alcohol more rewarding than males, the study showed. However, when their levels of the hormone oestrogen were reduced they found drinking less rewarding.

item.title: Police officer punched 70-year-old in road rage
item.description: PC Stuart Box attacked Peter Burgum (pictured), 70, in a fit of road rage before fleeing the scene in Gloucester. His victim passed away weeks later from unrelated causes.

item.title: How not to dye your lashes: Trinny's Instagram tutorial disaster sees her use dog NAPPY
item.description: The British style presenter, 56, who lives in West London with her millionaire partner Charles Saatchi, 76, took to her Instagram account to reveal she was trying her hand at some DIY beauty.

item.title: Professor Lockdown' Neil Ferguson admits he has the 'greatest respect' for Sweden
item.description: The Imperial College London scientist's modelling of the pandemic heavily influenced the UK's decision to lockdown in March. But his predictions have been heavily criticised.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg told Facebook staff he was 'disgusted' by Trump's comments
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg told Facebook employees that the decision to leave Trump's post about the killing of George Floyd in Minneapolis it up was 'personally pretty wrenching' for him.

item.title: UK soldiers hit by war crimes claims unlikely to face criminal trials
item.description: The Service Prosecution Authority said independent investigators had since dismissed almost all of the allegations due to the 'low level' of offending and a lack of credible evidence.

item.title: Canadian ex-wife of China's 'vaccine emperor' becomes a billionaire overnight after divorce
item.description: Canadian-Chinese Yuan Liping, 49, saw her wealth rocket after ending her marriage with 56-year-old biotech tycoon Du Weimin, who is dubbed the 'vaccine emperor' of China.

item.title: UK weather: Britain is set for its hottest day of the year today
item.description: May was the sunniest month in the UK since records began, but the country is now facing a gloomy start to the summer - just as the coronavirus lockdown is being eased.

item.title: Army deployed to US streets for first time since 1992 LA riots as George Floyd protests kick off
item.description: Between 200 and 250 military personnel from a unit at Fort Bragg in North Carolina are on their way to Washington, DC, and could arrive as soon as Monday night, Pentagon officials said.

item.title: Holly Willoughby is accused of not knowing George Floyd's name as she mispronounces it as 'Lloyd'
item.description: Holly Willoughby, 39, was revealing that This Morning would have a blackout at 11am to support the Black LIves Matter movement when she made the slip up.

item.title: Two 18-year-old organisers of the London Black Lives Matter protest are revealed
item.description: Today teenagers 'Aima' and 'Tash' were named as posting a series of hard hitting social media messages slamming Britain for being a 'racist country'.

item.title: Giant 27-inch horn belonging to an auroch is found in the River Severn estuary
item.description: The relic is an auroch horn which is thought to be around 5,000 years old and was discovered by two brothers off the coast of Sudbrook, Monmouthshire who work as fishermen.

item.title: Daredevil misses swimming pool trying to jump from trampoline
item.description: Jamie Smith hypes himself up for a long time bouncing on the trampoline before he makes the leap and falls face-first into the side of his pool at his home in Thornhill, Southampton.

item.title: Trump says 'I am your law and order president'
item.description: President Donald Trump declared himself the 'law and order president' as law enforcement officials used rubber bullets, tear gas and officers on horse back to clear out street for Trump photo op.

item.title: Tourism bosses warn quarantine plans could see 60% of jobs go as the PM swings behind 'air bridges'
item.description: Some 124 chief executive and owners of businesses worth a combined £5billion said they expect to make up to 60 per cent of their staff redundant unless the controversial plan for 14-day isolation are scrapped.

item.title: Woman reveals she's seven months pregnant with her sister's baby
item.description: Rebekah Bragdon Adamson, 34, who lives in Florida, is expecting a baby girl at the end of August, after her sister Brianna Bragdon, 28, agreed to be her surrogate.

item.title: Five-year-old girl who overcame Covid-19 symptoms beats Kawasaki disease
item.description: Despite being given just a 20 per cent chance of survival by doctors, five-year-old Scarlett Nicholas has returned home to Wakefield, West Yorkshire, after remarkably defeating Kawasaki disease.

item.title: Twilight star Gregory Tyree Boyce and his girlfriend died after taking cocaine and fentanyl
item.description: Twilight star Gregory Tyree Boyce, 30, and his partner Natalie Adepoju, 27, died inside the bedroom of their Las Vegas home. A coroner said they died from the effects of cocaine and fentanyl intoxication.

item.title: Doubts raised over Spain's COVID figures as country prepares to welcome tourists
item.description: Spain logged an average of 160 coronavirus deaths per day during May - before that figure dropped to just 1.6 per day after changes to the way it is calculated, with zero deaths on Monday.

item.title: Common active ingredient in dozens of over-the-counter remedies encourages the virus to multiply
item.description: An international team of scientists found that dextromethorphan, a common active ingredient in cough suppressants, can cause COVID-19 to replicate faster.

item.title: Bella Hadid, Rihanna and Cara Delevingne lead stars observing Black Out Tuesday
item.description: The movement comes after the death of African-American George Floyd, 46, last week, who died after Minneapolis police offiver Derek Chauvin knelt on his neck.

item.title: Monaco's masked royals: Prince Albert Princess Charlene and Princess Stephanie in Monte Carlo
item.description: Prince Albert, 62, and wife Princess Charlene, 42, donned face masks printed with the Grimaldi family crest as they joined other royals to open a casino square in Monte Carlo today.

item.title: Bored staff at London Covid swab site dress up toy HORSE in PPE
item.description: NHS staff working at Twickenham stadium in London have clearly had little to do as data showing the number of people swabbed in England has been 'unavailable' for ten consecutive days

item.title: Munroe Bergdorf slams L'Oreal over support for Black Lives Matter
item.description: The British model, 32, raged on social media at the beauty brand's post on Black Lives Matters, which reads 'speaking out is worth it', saying L'Oreal Paris 'threw me to the wolves for speaking out'

item.title: WHO were left in the dark over China's handling of Covid, an investigation reveals
item.description: Behind the scenes, it was a different story, one of significant delays by China and considerable frustration among WHO officials over not getting the information they needed to fight Covid-19.

item.title: STEPHEN GLOVER: Brussels is using Covid-19 as an excuse to put off Brexit
item.description: STEPHEN GLOVER: Britain may have left the EU, but its crucial future trading relations with the bloc are still being discussed, and in an unproductive and acrimonious way.
item.media:credit: Nicolas Landemard/Le Pictorium Agency via ZUMA/REX

item.title: The 'coregasm': Women say they are climaxing from doing ab workouts
item.description: New York-based fitness trainer Bec Donlan, 32, asked her Instagram followers whether anyone had experienced an orgasm while doing ab exercises at home.

item.title: Barber shop full of customers raided by police for staying open during lockdown
item.description: A barber shop in Nelson, Lancashire, was busted by police over the weekend after remaining open for custom during the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: McDonald's reopens 168 more drive thrus TODAY with another 22 restaurants starting deliveries
item.description: McDonald's is reopening more than 160 more drive thrus from 11am today as part of a major return more the fast food giant. Nearly 1,000 restaurants will reopen to customers with new social distancing rules.

item.title: No10 says coronavirus briefings are being AXED at weekends
item.description: The PM's spokesman said the press conferences were being scaled back as the response to the pandemic enters a 'different phase'.

item.title: Manhattan looters move to Midtown designer stores including Coach and Balenciaga
item.description: New York City's 11pm curfew failed to stop people smashing windows and running off with piles of merchandise from some of Fifth Avenues most-expensive stores.

item.title: Biblical village where Jesus fed the 5,000 is UNDERWATER as floods force experts to abandon dig site
item.description: Archaeologists have been working to prove that the lost ancient town once stood at El-Araj, an excavation site on the northern shore of the Sea of Galilee.

item.title: Pet dogs will try to save their distressed owner if they know how
item.description: Pet dogs will save their distressed owner even if there's nothing in it for them, new research has found - but as long as they know how.

item.title: Wuhan doctor whose skin turned dark due to coronavirus treatment 'dies'
item.description: Dr Hu Weifeng, who caught the virus through work in January, passed at a hospital in the former epicentre Wuhan, insiders told a website. The 42-year-old's skin had turned dark due to his treatment.

item.title: New York AG says 'Trump will not dominate New York' as she threatens to sue over military deployment
item.description: Letitia James, New York's attorney general, has threatened to sue President Trump (right) if he follows through on his pledge to deploy the military to American cities to put down protests.

item.title: Thorpe Hill Primary School in Bradford forced to close after staff tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: Thorpe Primary School in Idle, Bradford, is thought to be the second school to have to shut as pupils prepared to head back to the classroom. Parents have been told it won't re-open now until June 8.

item.title: M&S reveals post-lockdown stores and new rules for staff and customers
item.description: Retail analyst Springboard said they recorded an increase of shoppers in UK high streets of nearly one third on June 1, compared with the bank holiday Monday. Pictured: M&S Gillingham.

item.title: Teary groom ties the knot in virtual commitment ceremony in Hitched at Home
item.description: Viewers were left sobbing after Louise, 33, and Patrick, 35, who live in London and had their wedding cancelled due to COVID-19 pandemic, tied the knot in a virtual commitment ceremony.

item.title: UK statistics chief tears into Matt Hancock's 'misleading' coronavirus testing figures
item.description: In a withering rebuke for the Health Secretary, Sir David Norgrove told him the data presented to the public was 'still far from complete and comprehensible'.

item.title: Mother's £195,000 dream cliff edge home falls 70ft to the beach below after huge landslide in Kent
item.description: Dramatic images show how the bungalow in Eastchurch, on the Isle of Sheppey, left hanging yesterday, has been shattered overnight after the ground underneath it continued to give way.

item.title: Police caught eight speeding drivers doing more than 130mph during lockdown
item.description: The investigation found two-thirds of Britain's police forces caught people driving in excess of 100mph in the early stages of the epidemic.

item.title: Britain's Covid-19 death toll moves closer to 50,000
item.description: Data from the Office for National Statistics, National Records Scotland and Northern Ireland's statistics agency NISRA shows that 47,871 people had died of the coronavirus by May 22.

item.title: Queen celebrates the 67th anniversary of her Coronation with Instagram posts
item.description: The Queen, now 94, was 27 year old when she was crowned on 2 June 1953 in Westminster Abbey. Today the Royal Family Instagram account celebrated the 67th anniversary.

item.title: Thieves steal Channel 4 News presenter Cathy Newman's bike
item.description: The mother-of-two, 45, explained the mint green Compass bike had got her 'safely to work' in London throughout the pandemic, 'avoiding chances of being infected with coronavirus.'

item.title: Parents accuse teaching unions of 'sabotaging' schools reopening
item.description: The PM has been told by headteachers that it would be 'impossible' for some schools to have all younger children back safely within six weeks (pupils in London yesterday).

item.title: Porsche's roofless retro ride costs £137k and has a £10k matching watch
item.description: the Heritage Design Edition is £26,918 more expensive than the standard 911 Targa 4S launched last week, Only 992 examples are being made for global market, both cars and watches.

item.title: Teenager, 17, denies 16 sex offences against children at a nursery
item.description: The boy, who was arrested last November and cannot be named for legal reasons, has also denied two counts of historic rape not linked to the Jack and Jill Childcare nursery in Torquay, Devon.

item.title: One of London's skinniest houses goes up for sale for £1.9million
item.description: The cottage in Kensington, West London, has space for two bedrooms, two bathrooms and even a tiny study - with estate agents saying a 'meticulous Scandinavian design' has created the space.

item.title: Man City star Phil Foden breaches social distancing rules with a kick-about on the beach
item.description: Manchester City ace Phil Foden has appeared to breach social distancing guidelines by playing football on a beach in Merseyside over the weekend.

item.title: Experts admit it was possible Covid-19 was in the UK in DECEMBER
item.description: Andy Gill, 64, had returned from a band trip to China in late November and was struck down with a mystery respiratory illness in December. He died of pneumonia in early January.

item.title: Police hunt thieves who stole 67 piglets from farm
item.description: The piglets were stolen from the farm at Damerham in Fordingbridge, Hampshire, between May 20 and May 28, and have the reference HB0789 tattooed on them.

item.title: No proof Britain will be hit by a second Covid-19 wave
item.description: Professor Hugh Pennington, an emeritus microbiologist at University of Aberdeen, said the notion of a devastating second wave is based on outdated flu models.

item.title: Demolished building almost falls on pedestrian
item.description: A man was walking on the sidewalk when he had to run onto to the road to escape the two-story building being demolished that was about to fall on top of him in Esquimalt, British Columbia, Canada.

item.title: Moment International Space Station glides past the moon six hours after two NASA astronauts docked
item.description: Robert Behnken and Doug Hurley arrived at the ISS at 3.16pm on Sunday. They were photographed passing the moon by Italian photographer Alberto Ghizzi Panizza in Parma.

item.title: Britain's stately homes are turned into US-style drive-in movie theatres
item.description: Warwick Castle, Knebworth House and Blenheim Palace have agreed to take part in the event brought by The Luna Cinema, host of popular open-air film screenings in Britain.

item.title: CCTV shows casual burglars calmly raiding victim's house
item.description: The three masked men enter the property in Old Basford, Nottingham, at around 11.30pm on February 7, and calmly steal a number of items including a Playstation, Alexa and a laptop.

item.title: Nearly HALF of Britons admit they are drinking earlier in the day
item.description: Nearly 47 per cent of people who drink in Britain reported starting earlier in the day than usual during the pandemic, compared with 23 per cent in Greece - which saw the lowest increase.

item.title: Older dog unimpressed with hyperactive puppy
item.description: Boston terrier Sophie was still adjusting to her new puppy sibling Cooper in Airway Heights, Washington, when their owner filmed Sophie very unimpressed at Cooper's hyperactive antics.

item.title: Stunned family find extremely rare WHITE blackbird living in their garden hedge
item.description: A family revealed their excitement at discovering an extremely rare albino blackbird while feeding a nest of baby blackbirds they found in their garden hedge in Horsham St Faith, Norfolk.

item.title: Two pet turtles die and 'DRY OUT' after Chinese student left them in his dorm for five months
item.description: Footage shows the two dead turtles' bone-dry bodies discovered by the Chinese university student, Liu, when he returned to the campus. Liu planned to preserve the animals' corpses as specimens.

item.title: More than ELEVEN MILLION jobs are now being subsidised by the taxpayer
item.description: Some 8.7million workers are now on furlough, up 300,000 over the past week and adding another £2.5billion to the costs,

item.title: Interior expert reveals she's transformed her RENTED home with a very colourful scheme
item.description: Anna Jacobs, 50, has lived in a large two-floor rented flat in Crystal Palace for 18 months with her son, 13, and daughter, ten. During the family's time in the apartment, Anna has transformed the property.

item.title: Lost Lost Families: Man abandoned at railway tavern as a baby learns he has six siblings 56 years on
item.description: Simon Jeffery, 56, from Kent, who was left in a box outside railway tavern in Greenhithe, Kent in October 1963 learns he has six siblings 56 years on in ITV's Long Lost Families.

item.title: Two cyclists die after being struck by VW Golf during evening bike ride in High Wycombe
item.description: Emergency services attended the scene in High Wycombe, Buckinghamshire and tried to save the men aged 52 and 56. A driver involved in the collision is helping police with their inquiries.

item.title: Road rage thug is jailed for trying to shoot terrified taxi passengers with a CROSSBOW
item.description: Thomas King, 32, was jailed for two years and four months yesterday after the terrifying attack outside a casino in Nottingham city centre during the early hours of November 24 last year.

item.title: F1 is back! 2020 season to finally begin with Austria double header on July 5 and 12
item.description: Formula One has confirmed plans for Silverstone to host two Grands Prix on August 2 and 9 as it unveiled an eight-race European calendar to get the 2020 season under way.

item.title: Football pitch-sized area of tropical rainforest was lost every six seconds in 2019
item.description: 9.3 million acres of old-growth, or primary forests, was destroyed in 2019, the third biggest decline since the turn of the century and an area almost the size of Switzerland.

item.title: Lori Loughlin's daughter Olivia Jade slammed for 'tone deaf' white privilege post
item.description: The influencer, 20, shared a post on Sunday claiming she and her peers should 'use their white privilege to stop this' [racism], which was slammed following her parents involvement in the college admission scandal.

item.title: K-pop band BTS is forced to apologise over song featuring voice of American cult leader Jim Jones
item.description: The seven-piece South Korean boy band made a statement through their management on Sunday after a torrent of social media backlash, for using a Jim Jones sermon on one of their artist's tracks.

item.title: New Zealand set to scrap social distancing next week
item.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said in Wellington today: 'Our strategy of go hard, go early has paid off... and in some cases, beyond expectations.'

item.title: Dating app Grindr removes 'ethnicity filter' allowing users to search for potential partners by race
item.description: Singletons prepared to pay £12.99-a-month for premium can use the filter to sort users based on their ethnicity. Grindr took the decision less than 24 hours after it was forced to delete a tweet.

item.title: Bright ideas to make your eyes sparkle...A massager for puffiness and a pill to soothe screen damage
item.description: Elizabeth Hawkes, a consultant ophthalmic and oculoplastic surgeon at the Royal Berkshire Hospital NHS Trust and the Cadogan Clinic in London, assesses a range of eye health products.

item.title: Meghan Markle is 'linked' to journalist who wrote Tatler article about Kate Middleton
item.description: Anna Pasternak wrote claims in Tatler including that Kate fell out with Meghan in a row over whether Princess Charlotte should wear tights as a bridesmaid at her wedding.

item.title: Five-year-old elephant dies in agony after being shot in Thailand
item.description: Medics battled to save a five-year-old Asian elephant after he was found badly injured with five gunshot wounds on farmland in the south of Thailand, but he died of his wounds two days later.

item.title: Tesla Model 3 'on Autopilot mode' crashes into truck in Taiwan
item.description: Security cameras watching a highway in Taiwan captured a Tesla Model 3 vehicle plowing into truck that was rolled over on its side. The driver said the incident occurred while he was using Autopilot.

item.title: Mother-of-two is left in hysterics after parenting hack goes awry
item.description: Donna Evans, 32, who lives in Cannock, West Midlands, reveals she was left in hysterics when her children Hallie, seven and Issac, three, covered themselves in paint, while she took a Zoom call.

item.title: Could Dorset be first back in full lockdown? MP Tobias Ellwood warns of beach-linked infection spike
item.description: Former defence minister Tobias Ellwood said he was worried that idiotic scenes at picturesque Durdle Door on the south coast could see a spike in coronavirus cases in the area.

item.title: Girl's arm is blown off when her father uses an angle grinder to cut open a gasoline barrel
item.description: A five-year-old girl lost her arm and her mother was seriously injured when an oil barrel exploded in a community allotment garden in Hamelin, Lower Saxony on Saturday.

item.title: Prostate cancer is now the most commonly diagnosed form
item.description: A total of 57,192 men in England, Scotland, Northern Ireland and Wales were told they had it in 2018 - a substantial rise from 48,690 the previous year and up from around 24,000 in 1998.

item.title: The decor that can add THOUSANDS to the value of your home
item.description: British homes decorated in a chic, neutral Scandinavian style are worth £340,224 more than the average UK home, according to data from financial advice website Bankrate.

item.title: Crooked sales rep who stole £30,000 of PPE is jailed for more than two years
item.description: A crooked sales rep who stoles £30,000 of PPE and sold it on eBay to pay for a darts trip has been jailed for two years. He sold vital equipment at 'inflated prices' reaching five times the usual value.

item.title: House prices suffer biggest drop since February 2009, says Nationwide
item.description: In May, the average cost of a home fell by 1.7 per cent month-on-month, marking the sharpest decline since the depths of the financial crisis.

item.title: Spain will take legal action against Ryanair and EasyJet over their Covid-19 refund policies
item.description: The Spanish government has promised court action against at least 17 airlines including easyJet and Ryanair over their customer refund practices following the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Restaurant in Netherlands will use robot waiters to help comply with with social-distancing rules
item.description: The restaurants pair of robotic waiters will pick up dishes, serve food, and greet customers with 'hello and welcome' once the restaurant, and others in the country, work to reopen this week.
item.media:description: Leah Hu, left, and her brother Leon demonstrate the use of robots for serving purposes or for dirty dishes collection, as part of a tryout of measures to respect social distancing and help curb the spread of the COVID-19 coronavirus, at the family's Royal Palace restaurant in Renesse, south-western Netherlands, Wednesday, May 27, 2020. (AP Photo/Peter Dejong)

item.title: Pregnant 2,000-pound great white shark swims some 700 miles into the Atlantic to avoid males
item.description: A 15-foot-long, 2,000-pound great white shark has fled 700 miles off the coast of Cape Cod to avoid mating attempts from other males - something experts call a 'pelagic journey.'

item.title: Stunning images of the Sun are taken from a Kent garden by a retired lecturer
item.description: Paul Andrew of Dover snapped the images using his Lund 152 telescope, in which he has invested significant funds, he says.

item.title: Your guide to the best prostate cancer care... As it becomes the most diagnosed cancer in Britain
item.description: Ground-breaking research, together with greater awareness - highlighted by the Daily Mail's End The Needless Prostate Deaths campaign - is changing the outlook for men with the condition.

item.title: Tiger King star Carole Baskin wins control of rival Joe Exotic's 16.4-acre Oklahoma zoo
item.description: Tiger King star Carole Baskin has been given control of her rival Joe Exotic's former zoo in Oklahoma, following a bombshell judge ruling.

item.title: Ornate prayer book belonging to and inscribed by Mary, Queen of Scots, goes up for sale
item.description: Mary, Queen of Scots' hand-painted book dates back to the 16th century and would have been kept close by the devout Catholic. It will be auctioned by Christie's next month.

item.title: Chris Whitty thwarted Boris Johnson's wish to downgrade UK's coronavirus threat level
item.description: The prime minister had wanted to reduce the five-stage alert level after announcing the partial easing of lockdown restrictions, which came into force yesterday.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS reviews last night's TV: A handbag?
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: The haughty Lady Bracknell's reaction, when she discovers her future son-in-law was abandoned as a baby is the stuff of theatre legend.

item.title: Coronavirus: North England infection rate nearly twice London's
item.description: Using figures from the Covid Symptom Study, Kings College London researchers were able to estimate infection rates in different regions across the country.

item.title: Sister-in-law of Rachael Slack says coronavirus has reminded her abuse victims still need help
item.description: The sister-in-law of pregnant Rachael Slack, 38, who was murdered by her ex-partner, Andrew Cairns, 44, along with their 23-month-old son still fears for domestic abuse victims during lockdown

item.title: Boris Johnson's plan to get all primary school pupils back to class before summer is 'under review'
item.description: School leaders say some primary schools are simply 'too small' to allow proper safety measures to mitigate the risk of coronavirus to be implemented in time for students to return.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Roll out the barrel, it's the New Normal...
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Lockdown was partially eased in England yesterday, but don't all cheer at once. Some of the 'temporary' restrictions were also enshrined in law.

item.title: Schoolgirl, 14, tells how pins and needles turned out to be an inoperable brain tumour
item.description: Grace Gaskell, from Rickmansworth, Hertfordshire, was diagnosed with an anaplastic astrocytoma (grade III) brain tumour in July 2018, her mother Rebecca told FEMAIL.

item.title: Family of Watership Down author Richard Adams win back rights to the book
item.description: The book, which presents animals in the British countryside as refugees fleeing destruction wrought by man, was written by civil servant Richard Adams and released in 1972.

item.title: PE teacher shares the foods she eats three times weekly to transform her figure in 24 hours
item.description: An Australian PE teacher has shared the exact foods she turns to when she is feeling tired, bloated and sluggish - and how they will transform your figure in just 24 hours. Belinda Norton shared it.

item.title: Kate Middleton and Prince William to send a video message to Australia's first responders
item.description: Kate Middleton, 38, recycled the £900 yellow dress which she first wore while visiting Sydney in 2014, as she joined Prince William, 37, for the video message to thank frontline workers.

item.title: Adorable moment a rare long-nosed echidna named JR emerges from his Taronga Zoo burrow
item.description: The rare monotreme named JR was spotted crawling out of his habitat at Sydney's Taronga Zoo as guests were invited back to the zoo under relaxed coronavirus restrictions.

item.title: The top ten trickiest quiz questions
item.description: The questions are all taken from the National General Knowledge Test, produced by British broadcaster Sky, which is made up of the '100 essential quiz questions.

item.title: Do you like your egg yolks runny or hard?
item.description: An online debate has been sparked over whether egg yolks should be runny or hard after pictures of different yolk consistencies were shared on social media.

item.title: Evidence suggests even those with mild covid-19 symptoms can be left with long-term damage to organs
item.description: Patients in the UK who have tested positive for Covid-19 will be counting their lucky stars that they have had only a mild encounter with the deadly virus - but they may not be able to relax just yet.

item.title: Personal trainer Rachel Dillon shares the six things to do from home to put on muscle and lose fat
item.description: A personal trainer has shared her 'women's guide to building muscle' and revealed exactly why eating more and lifting heavy will not make you bulky. Rachel Dillon, from Queensland, shared tips.

item.title: Girl, 18, is arrested on suspicion of murder after boy, 18, stabbed to death in 'domestic incident'
item.description: It was unclear what the relationship was between the victim, who died in hospital last night, and the woman arrested, although police termed the alleged murder a 'domestic incident'.

item.title: Leading UK breast surgeon is probed over alleged text messages
item.description: Olivier Branford, one of the UK's leading breast surgeons, is accused of sending sexually explicit messages to the well-known woman in her 30s.

item.title: Domino's experts reveal best hacks for reheating leftover pizza
item.description: Sandwiching slices in a jaffle iron and microwaving single pieces beside a glass of water are the best ways to reheat leftover pizza, food researchers at Domino's Australia have revealed.

item.title: Police issue appeal to find girl, 13, who vanished from her Hertfordshire home
item.description: Maddie Cooper was last seen at around 11am at her home address in Letchworth, north Hertfordshire.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... car dealers reopening
item.description: 'Feel free to have a little run around in it if you want to test your eyesight'

item.title: Dr MICHAEL MOSLEY's guide to helping you fight back against coronavirus
item.description: DR MICHAEL MOSLEY: Many of us eat such a narrow range of foods that our gut bacteria are forced to exist on a restricted diet. And it doesn't make them happy.

item.title: Police launch manhunt after teen was stabbed and run-over in Weald Lane, Harrow, northwest London
item.description: The victim, said to be in his late teens, is fighting for his life in hospital following the attack in Weald Lane, Harrow, northwest London, on Monday night.

item.title: CRAIG BROWN: As dreams get more vivid in lockdown...
item.description: CRAIG BROWN: The conservative commentator Charles Moore was appearing on a televised version of Radio 4'sToday programme.

item.title: Boris Johnson's former prep school shuts its doors for ever after pupil numbers slump
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: A few weeks from now, no one else will be forking out its eye-watering fees of £28,680 a year.

item.title: Policeman in jail for drugs racket gets extra year for TV scam
item.description: PC Daniel Aimson (pictured with his wife Rachel), 39, who was with Greater Manchester Police, admitted conspiracy to defraud at Manchester Crown Court.

item.title: With salons still shut, we challenged four couples to cut their hair
item.description: Charlotte Martin, 40, is an employability consultant. She lives with husband Paul, 60, and their children Dylan, 11, and Meredith, eight, in Wiltshire. She says: 'The end result was not too bad'.

item.title: 3D simulation of body more accurately establishes time of death
item.description: By adding certain data to a computer model, scientists are able to create a 3D simulation of a dead body and determine the victim's time of death down to minutes in order to help officials solve the murder.

item.title: Emirates president warns it could take up to four years to rebuild the airline's entire network
item.description: Tim Clark said that the current period would be the most difficult in the Dubai-based airline's history, but he said that the industry could start to recover by summer 2021 if a vaccine was developed.

item.title: New video shows £195k Kent home hanging over 70ft cliff edge
item.description: Emma Tullett, 42, had only purchased her two-bedroom bungalow in August 2018, when the home in Eastchurch, on the Isle of Sheppey in Kent, plunged off a cliff on Sunday.

item.title: How to have sex during lockdown
item.description: Researchers from Harvard University in Boston, Massachusetts, said the close contact associated with any kind of sexual activity was a coronavirus transmission risk, even if sex itself didn't spread it.

item.title: Coronavirus: Italian doctors say samples of virus getting weaker
item.description: Doctors in Italy said patient samples they are analysing now contain significantly smaller amounts of the coronavirus than the ones they saw during the peak of the outbreak.

item.title: Mother-of-five tells how HALF of her £195,000 dream home plunged over a cliff edge overnight
item.description: Emma Tullett, 42, only bought her £195,000, two-bedroom bungalow in August 2018. But the property in Eastchurch, on the Isle of Sheppey in Kent, today plunged off the cliff

item.title: Isle of Sheppey homes evacuated after cliff collapse leaves house 'hanging' over the edge
item.description: Groups of residents on the Isle of Sheppey had to be evacuated from their homes after a cliff suddenly collapsed on Friday night, sparking fears of a collapse into the murky waters below.
